Under the empire all this was changed: the political rewards of the bar were curtailed 3 its honourable influence in politics was all but destroyed. Those who prosecuted occasionally for ambition, and those who prosecuted habitually as a trade, found themselves merged in an odious class whose only func· tion seemed to be the invention of pretexts for delivering all who had anything to lose to the capricious greed and cruelty of the government.
